newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai baht dives to new low of 30.03 vs dollar.
newsitem.headline: Thai baht dives to new low of 30.03 vs dollar.

text.p: The Thai baht tumbled to new record low of 30.03 to the dollar in mid-afternoon trade on Friday largely affected by spillover negative sentiment from events gripping the Philippine peso, dealers said.
The baht weakened sharply from 29.75 in early morning trade.
At 0838, the baht was quoted at the bid/offer range of 29.99/30.06 per dollar.
"The baht fell to 30.03 in the mid-afternoon trade. The dollar was very well bid following the peso jitters," said one dealer at a European bank.
The peso tumbled after the Philippine central bank allowed the currency to move in a wider range against the U.S. dollar.
"So far there remains no trace of central bank intervention. Commercial demand for dollars was also very strong as importers feared that the baht will weaken further," said another dealer.
In the offshore market, the baht fell to 29.50/30.00 from 29.30/29.50 in the morning.
